channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel's military publishes first report on 7 October 2023 failures
item.description: The report says the military "failed in its mission to protect Israeli civilians" during Hamas's attack.

item.title: Musk makes baseless claim about large number of dead people on federal payroll
item.description: Elon Musk's speculation about dead or fictitious employees comes after numerous federal workers were told to ignore an email asking them to justify th...

item.title: Trump says new tariffs will cut U.S. drug deaths but fatal overdoses were already plummeting
item.description: President Trump cited outdated drug overdose data to justify tariffs against Canada, China, and Mexico. He also offered no evidence Canada is fueling ...

item.title: How European nations are appealing to Trump, boosting defense spending
item.description: European nations that are part of NATO are boosting their defense spending and are appealing to President Trump's demands on contributions. Charlotte ...

item.title: ICE will reopen a major detention center in New Jersey as it eyes a broader expansion
item.description: The Trump administration is expanding its immigration detention capacity, reopening a 1,000-bed detention center in New Jersey and adding beds at othe...

item.title: Why are coffee prices soaring in the U.S.?
item.description: Consumers still coping with high food costs face scalding hot coffee prices, with retail costs up 75% in recent years.

item.title: Israel's army underestimated Hamas before Oct. 7 attack, probe finds
item.description: The findings could pressure Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to launch a widely demanded broader inquiry to examine the political decision-ma...

item.title: Alzheimer's was taking her memory, so she started taking a new drug
item.description: Myra Solano Garcia, who has Alzheimer's, says the drug Kisunla may be one reason she can still drive, cook, and sing.

item.title: Starmer says UK is prepared to put troops in Ukraine to support peace deal during Trump presser
item.description: President Trump held a press conference with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer at the White House where they discussed the future of Ukraine's secur...

item.title: Tate brothers arrive in US after Romania prosecutors lift travel ban
item.description: The pair, facing trial for human trafficking, had been banned from leaving Romania in recent years.

item.title: Oscar-winner Gene Hackman, wife Betsy Arakawa and their dog were dead for some time, warrant shows
Thailand deports dozens of Uyghurs to China
item.description: The move comes after rights groups warned the Uyghurs face torture and possibly death back in China.

item.title: Pamela Anderson on missing out on Oscars, ditching makeup and 'innocence' of Baywatch
item.description: The actress's career has enjoyed a recent resurgence thanks to a role in the film The Last Showgirl.

item.title: Gene Hackman and his wife Betsy Arakawa found dead at their home
item.description: Authorities say there was no sign the couple had sustained any injuries, but no cause of death has been given.

item.title: Influencer Tate brothers, who face human trafficking charges in Romania, arrive in the US
In a reversal, plans for U.S. natural gas power grow, complicating progress on climate
item.description: A spike in demand for electricity from tech companies competing in the artificial intelligence race is upending forecasts for natural gas-fired power ...

item.title: USAID workers return to HQ to clear their desks, as Trump dismantles the agency
